g.text: Do Not Cite, Quote or Distribute
BEVs have higher purchase prices than ICEVs, though a sharp decline has been observed since AR5.
Due to the rapid development of the lithium
ion battery technology over the years
and the introduction of subsidies in several countries, BEVs are quickly reaching cost parity with

and BEVs, BEVs show lower LCC

FCVs represent the most expensive solution for
, mainly due to the currently higher purcha
of the vehicle itself. However, given the lower technology readiness level of FCVs and the current
efforts in the research and development of this technology, FCVs could become a viable technology for
LDVs in the coming years. The issues regarding
the extra energy involved in creating the
and its delivery to refuelling sites remain, however. The levelized cost of
is lower than conventional fossil fuels but higher than electricity. In addition, within the levelize
, there are significant cost differences between the
onventional technologies such as coal gasification and steam methane reforming from natural gas,
both with and without carbon capture and storage, represent the cheapest options
2019; Parkinson et al. 2019; Khzouz et al. 2020; Al
electrolysis is currently the most expensive technology, but with significant potential cost reductions
urban transport services to millions of people around the world and a
growing number of transport agencies are exploring alternative
powered buses include buses powered with CNG, LNG, synthetic
biofuels (e.g., biodiesel, renewable diesel, dimethyl ether); diesel hybrid
fuel cell buses. Rail is an alternative mode of transit that
based passenger mobility. Electric rail systems can provide urban
services (light rail and metro systems), as well as longer dist
ance transport. Indeed, many cities of the
world already have extensive metro systems, and regions like China, Japan and Europe have a robust
city railway network. Intercity rail transport can be powered with electricity; however,
uels are still prevalent for long
distance rail passenger transport in some regions. Battery electric
distance trains may be a future option for these areas.
shows the life cycle GHG emissions from different powertrain and fuel technologies for
buses and passenger rail. The data in each panel came from a number of relevant scientific studies
2019e; Tong et al. 2015a; Dimoula et al. 2016; de Bortoli et al. 2017; Meynerts et al. 2018; Cai et al.
Hill et al. 2020; Liu et al. 2020a; Valente et al. 2021, 2017)
The width of the bar represents the variability in available estimates, which is primarily driven by
variability in reported vehicle efficiency, size
or drive cycle. While some bars overl
not fully capture correlations between results. For example, low efficiency associated with aggressive
drive cycles may drive the upper end of the emission ranges for multiple technologies; thus, an overlap
ncertainty regarding which vehicle type would have lower emissions for
a comparable trip. Additionally, reported life cycle emissions do not include embodied GHG emissions
associated with infrastructure construction and maintenance. These embodied emission
a larger fraction of life cycle emissions for rail than for other transport modes
, although embodied emissions from rail are known
. These caveats are also applicable to the
